product_category_rules.name: PCR 2012:01 Construction Products and Construction Services

epd_metadata.independent_third_party_verification: EPD process certification and data, according to ISO 14025:2006

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for residential applications, low rise buildings, paving or driveways. Specification and ordering simplified.
product_classes.special_class: Allows purchaser to specify special requirements for major and high-end construction projects including high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate)
databases_and_software_used: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) 2017
World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) Cement Sustainability Initiative (CSI) Tool Project Database (International Version) 2018
Product specific EPDs for admixtures and fibres

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded on basis of cut-off criteria

data_quality.foreground_data: Medium or higher for geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data: Updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2012:01

lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes use stage, end of life stage, benefits and loads outside system boundary
excluded_lifecycle_stages: Benefits and loads outside system boundary
system_diagram_processes: Transport by freight ship, rigid truck, domestic freight ship

scenarios: Disposal of concrete at landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration
Crushing/recycling of concrete: crushed concrete substitutes primary material without further processing or substitutes natural aggregates in fresh concrete
end_of_life.note: End of life scenarios not included in this EPD; should be considered in whole-of-life building studies

carbon_emission_context.global_warming_potential: Provided per mix type in kg CO2 equivalents per m³

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime (reabsorption)
carbonation.consideration: Not included in this EPD; recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 for allocation

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (AusLCI) (2015)
Man Yu et al., 'The Carbon Footprint of Australia’s Construction Sector', Procedia Engineering, 2017
